attributes.action: provide each and every household with a computer and affordable internet access.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Computers have become part of our everyday lives, and have been described as being a wealth of information at your fingertips. They allow you to do things which, around ten years ago, wouldn't have even been imaginable. 

In 2001/2002, around 33% of UK households owned at least one computer; this rose to 70% in 2007. 63% of UK households currently have access to broadband, whilst a fair percentage of those own an internet connection, but no form of device which allows them to utilise such connection.

Recently, the government stated its plans regarding changes to modern, high-speed telecommunications infrastructures throughout Britain.

The logic being, why focus on the majority when there is still a large minority without access to the internet in the form of a computer?
